title: Album Page, "Façade Elevation, Vieille Maison, Blois", June 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: 43; clockwise from right: stands out about 0.65 or 0.70; (written on ruled lines): Echelle 0.02 = M 1. / Vieille Maison Blois / Juin 1888; There are three / beams here with / Gothic molding / stands out about 0.35.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating the façade elevation and façade section of a four story medieval half-timbered and plastered building.  There is a door opening framed with Gothic decoration on the ground floor level at right.  The two stories above repeat the Gothic ogee arch of the door opening on both sides of the building. These arches are filled with crossed timber deocration, and frame a set of double windows with window boxes in the center.  The attic story has a small dormer over the windows, and the roof appears to be made of slate and tile.  To the right of this is a section of the façade elevation.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Façade Elevation, Vieille Maison, Blois", June 1888.Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-34.
